image.altText: A woman wearing a cap stands in front of palm trees

props.synopsis: A government review into Israel's response to an air strike that killed Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom and six others found "serious" procedural failures and errors in decision-making led to their deaths.

title.children: 'Serious' IDF failures led to death of World Central Kitchen aid workers in Gaza

image.altText: Fighters in camouflage stand in front of a coffin with a large picture of Fuad Shukr displayed on the wall behind

props.synopsis: The leader of Lebanese militant group Hezbollah warns that the conflict with Israel is in a "new phase", as he addresses mourners at the funeral of a commander from the group who was killed by an Israeli air strike this week in Beirut.

title.children: Hezbollah leader says war with Israel has entered 'new phase' after killings of top militant figures

image.altText: A group of men throw peace signs for the camera

props.synopsis: Iran blames Israel for the assassination of a Hamas leader in Tehran this week, saying it has a "duty" to seek revenge. So, what might Iran do next?

title.children: An assassination on Iranian soil is a 'huge, humiliating blow'. Here are the three ways they might respond

image.altText: 5qhmurray

props.synopsis: It was another golden day in the pool for Australia, but plenty happening throughout the Paris Olympics that you might not have seen on the TV. Here's today's quick hits from the Games.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Daggy dad goes viral, Murray's cheeky tweet, and sponsor gets tongues wagging

image.altText: A man with white hair, and a black jumper, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading sharply lower on Friday after global markets fell overnight, with growing concerns that the global economy is slowing at a faster pace than previously thought. Follow live.

title.children: ASX experiences its worst day since March 2023 as fears grow about global economy slowing

image.altText: Drone photos of the Kwinana big battery Stage One

props.synopsis: Like much of the country, WA is embracing rooftop solar with breathtaking gusto. But the state's position as the world's biggest island grid is posing a unique problem with authorities asking the question — how much solar is too much solar?

title.children: How the rise of solar power in Western Australia is a cautionary tale for the world

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan, Lani Pallister, Bri Throssell, Ariarne Titmus stand and smiel

props.synopsis: Led by the two greatest 200m swimmers of all time, Australia came together once again to create an unstoppable winning machine at last.

title.children: Titmus's 'personal vendetta' burns as rivals come together to lead Aussies to a golden victory

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds with Parliament House in the backdrop.

props.synopsis: The defamation action launched by WA Senator Linda Reynolds against Brittany Higgins and her partner David Sharaz is now underway in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Reynolds was made the 'villain' in Brittany Higgins' cover-up 'fairytale', senator's lawyer tells court

image.altText: PinkPantheress sits side on in a room with dark blue curtains and leopard print wall

props.synopsis: "I will not be able to continue with the rest of my live shows this year in order to focus on my physical health and overall wellbeing," the 23-year-old singer posted overnight.

title.children: English pop star PinkPantheress cancels Australian tour, including Coldplay stadium shows

image.altText: A photo of Joya (right) and her husband (left) hugging.

props.synopsis: In light of a potentially escalating war between Lebanon and Israel, Australians in Lebanon are asked to leave and others are told to avoid travel. But many won't be deterred.

title.children: Lebanese Australians say they're 'used to' travel warnings. It won't stop their holiday plans

image.altText: Video screenshots of a man holding a knife.

props.synopsis: A gruesome video showing a bush-knife wielding gang decapitating the dead body of a villager in PNG's East Sepik province emerges on social media, as local police use the footage to track down the alleged perpetrators.

title.children: Gang celebrates decapitation of Papua New Guinean villager in online video

image.altText: Kamala Harris, wearing a light blue suit, walks up an aircraft staircase and waves.

props.synopsis: Two weeks since Trump narrowly avoided assassination, the race for the White House is upended – and the Republican contender has long abandoned his short-lived shift to a "nice" tone.

title.children: As Trump questions Harris's racial identity, Democrats are trying a simple message: He and Vance are 'weird'

image.altText: A young child participates in the opening ceremony of the 2017 Garma Festival.

props.synopsis: After fire, a new life cycle begins — and in the 10 months since the defeat of the Voice to Parliament referendum, the conditions are right for new ideas to germinate.

title.children: Fire clears a way for new ideas to flourish at the first Garma since the defeat of the Voice

image.altText: A group of people in a small aircraft cabin, with an American flag.

props.synopsis: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and ex-marine Paul Whelan, who the US says were jailed in Russia after "sham" trials, are among 24 people freed in a global prisoner swap involving at least seven countries.

title.children: Americans freed from Russian penal colonies in largest East-West prisoner swap since Cold War

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man in a gingham shirt

props.synopsis: Mr Navalny, the fiercest political foe of Russian President Vladimir Putin, died in February in an Arctic penal colony while serving a 19-year sentence on extremism charges.

title.children: Former Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was meant to be included in prisoner swap

image.altText: GettyImages-2164158332

props.synopsis: Boris Van Der Vorst defends the IOC over its handling of gender testing, as an Italian boxer quits mid-fight against Algerian Imane Khelif.

title.children: 'Sad situation for all boxers': Head of World Boxing addresses issues over gender after Italian boxer quits mid-round

image.altText: A woman holds a gun and another woman rides a bike.

props.synopsis: A town of 3,800 residents in the heart of Victorian dairy farming country has won more medals at the Paris Games than Argentina, Ecuador and Brazil.

title.children: The tiny Australian town that has won more Olympic medals than entire countries

image.altText: Simone Biles looks relaxed as a swarm of cameras surround her

props.synopsis: Simone Biles is quite clearly the greatest gymnast to have ever lived, but that doesn't go far enough to describe her impact. The scenes in Paris as she won yet another Olympic gold prove she is far more than a champion athlete.

title.children: The Simone Biles experience has transcended sport and become the hottest ticket in Paris

image.altText: A group photo of Anthony Albanese and 16 other members of government.

props.synopsis: The prime minister's reshuffle tells us much about political realities — and political problems.

title.children: Albanese's ministry reshuffle is another nail in the coffin of a republic. It also says a lot about the political problems he's facing

image.altText: Clare Looker stands at a press conference, dressed in a white jacket.

props.synopsis: A woman in her 90s has died in Victoria's Legionnaires' disease outbreak, which authorities believe started in cooling towers in Melbourne's industrial west.

title.children: Woman in 90s dies in Victorian Legionnaires' disease outbreak

image.altText: High-rise buildings line a city street.

props.synopsis: Apartment living is taking off, but a supply shortage in NSW as building costs climb is slowing its pace.

title.children: The switch to apartment living is well underway, but supply lags as construction costs rise

image.altText: Rex Airlines logo on the fuselage of one of its aircraft, 2007

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Rex Airlines employees have been officially let go from the regional carrier after receiving formal notices of termination.

title.children: Hundreds of Rex Airlines staff notified of termination after carrier enters voluntary administration

image.altText: A man using a red walker. He is wearing a blue medical mask.

props.synopsis: Frank Terrence Keating committed the offences against five students while he was working as a teacher and then principal at De La Salle College in Scarborough, in south-east Queensland.

title.children: 'Ruined their lives': Catholic brother who abused students on school grounds could be released in 2026

image.altText: A yellow road closed sign across a rural road.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man has been charged over a car crash at Tarago, near Canberra, in which three people died.

title.children: Man charged over car crash near Canberra in which three friends died

image.altText: A photographer looks up while holding a lighting device at the Milky Way surrounded by leafless trees

props.synopsis: It might be chilly, but Australia’s night sky puts on a dazzling show at this time of year – and this weekend is particularly good if you have clear weather. Rug up and use our guide to see if you can spot some of our winter wonders.

title.children: Australia gets a front-row seat to some of the best night skies in the world in winter

image.altText: A composite impage of Jess Fox biting her gold medal, a McDonald's icon and a portrait photo of Robert Downey Jr.

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about the news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Australia's pot of gold, a McDonald's first, and Robert Downey Jr's return

image.altText: A man and a woman, both middle-aged and Indigenous, stand outside a hospital emergency department.

props.synopsis: There is a desperate need for organ donation in the Northern Territory, but Aboriginal health workers say it can be a difficult topic to talk about.

title.children: In many Aboriginal communities, organ donation can be 'taboo'. These health workers are trying to change that

image.altText: NT Police Minister Brent Potter looking depressed while standing outside.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has announced it has identified issues with the enforcement of fines and penalties, dating back at least a decade.

title.children: 'Monumental stuff-up': Enforcement of unpaid NT fines dating back a decade could be unlawful

image.altText: Orange and black packets inside grey machinery

props.synopsis: Authorities say they have disrupted an attempt to import almost 900 kilograms of methamphetamine hidden in industrial machinery.

title.children: Sydney man charged over plot to import $828 million worth of methamphetamine

image.altText: Two cups of red coloured Korean instant noodle cups.

props.synopsis: Increasing turbulence is knocking a beloved instant noodle offering off Korean Air's economy menu.

title.children: Hot cup noodles off the menu on Korean airline due to dangerous turbulence

image.altText: A dog with brown curly hair sits in the middle of a dirt road surrounded by grass.

props.synopsis: Owners of dogs bought from breeder Tasmanian Labradoodles have spoken out about significant problems and large vet bills, after the breeder reached an out-of-court agreement with the RSPCA to shut down immediately.

title.children: 'It wasn't the right dog': Labradoodle owners consider legal action after Tasmanian business shuts amid overbreeding allegations

image.altText: Cass walks with a deer slung over her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Seeking a direct connection with what they eat, these people have turned to hunting wild animals in Victoria's forests.

title.children: These meat-eaters don't want to 'contract the kill', so they're heading into Victoria's forests to find their own meat
